pinyin: chuang1 shang1 hou4 xin1 li3 ya1 li4 jin3 zhang1 zong1 he2 zheng4
containing_words.word: 创伤后心理压力紧张综合症

sentences.english: Spitting in the street is considered to be very bad mannered.
sentences.chinese: 拂逆地吐痰，在街上吐痰是很紧张的坏习气。

sentences.english: It was nerve-wracking somehow this year. But I still came through.
sentences.chinese: 今年很多时候有些紧张刺激，但我都挺过来了。

sentences.english: It was after dark and I was nervous, so when he pulled up I immediately jumped in the car.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，我很紧张，看到车过来了就跳上去。

sentences.english: Increased positive feelings and reduced feelings of anxiety, anger and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 增加正面的工作情绪，减少紧张，愤怒及懮伤。

sentences.english: Initial tension melted into transparency and forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 最初的紧张融化为透明和饶恕。

sentences.english: In the tang sugar nervous and ChengXi explain yesterday nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 在路上唐糖紧张的和程曦解释昨天什么也没发生。

sentences.english: Insomnia is both a symptom and a cause of depression and anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 失眠既是一种症状又是导致沮丧和紧张的肇因。

sentences.english: Aeriform lieutenant general does group of relations intimately to be done aloof and tensely originally.
sentences.chinese: 无形中将原本亲密的干群关系弄得疏远而紧张了。

sentences.english: How can you have the heebie-jeebies for Mr. Alex?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能有说亚历克斯先生焦虑，紧张，沮丧呢？

sentences.english: Obviously, Cuiping was nervous and so her smile was not genuine.
sentences.chinese: 翠平显然很紧张，笑声一点儿也不好听。

sentences.english: Sweet words is not important any more .
sentences.chinese: 蜜语甜言已不再那么紧张。

sentences.english: Uptight men drink alcohol and invade another country.
sentences.chinese: 紧张的男人喝白酒，入侵别国。

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 刚一上岸，他俩显得相当紧张，并且止不住的发抖。

sentences.english: Before going into the room, take three DEEP breaths!
sentences.chinese: 进考场前的深呼吸可以帮你舒缓压力及紧张情绪。

sentences.english: "How, purple Qiao?"Purple wreath 1 face is nervous.
What is the major cause of the labour-management strife?
sentences.chinese: 精神紧张是引起心脏病的主要原因。

to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
